item.title: PSN Is Currently Down for Some Users
item.description:
Gamers are reporting difficulties with using PlayStation online services due to an apparent PlayStation Network outage. PlayStation has acknowledged the issue with PSN and is working on a fix.

The PlayStation Network is the backbone of online gaming for players on the consoles, so when it goes down, accessing online games is often impossible. This can also have an impact on other PlayStation services, like viewing trophies or account data.

PlayStation Network Outage on 10/14/2025

Numerous reports began emerging at around 7pm PT on the evening of October 14 saying that players were having difficulty accessing their games, or were booted offline. The problem doesn't seem to be completely universal, as some players have had luck with resetting their consoles or trying again after waiting a while. Downdetector also reports that player complaints regarding the outage have diminished in the hours following the initial reports, but some are still having issues even now. PlayStation's website shows that the system is having issues, and that all gaming and social activities, including Challenges, Help, Game streaming, Touranments, and Trophies may be impacted. At this time, PlayStation Video and the Store seem to be unaffected.

Sadly, when this happens, there's not much more that players can do but wait. Booting up an offline game is one potential option, while others boot up different consoles or their PC to get their gaming fix in the meantime. With any luck, Sony will track down the issue or issues and get players back online without them having to wait much longer.

item.title: Horror Games Where You Have All The Power
item.description:
Most horror games really build their fear around helplessness. Players find themselves hiding in closets, scrambling for precious ammo, or just praying that the flashlight battery doesn’t die at the worst possible moment. But some horror completely flips that script. These titles put players in control of overwhelming power, allowing them to become the monster rather than just running from it.

The fear comes not from being hunted. It comes from the unsettling realization of what that power truly means, and how it utterly reshapes the entire experience. Sometimes it feels exhilarating, a real rush. Other times, it's just plain sickening. But in every single case, it warps traditional horror into something far stranger, far darker.

Carrion

Becoming The Thing Under The Bed

Carrion
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
July 23, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Phobia Studios
Powered by

Carrion doesn’t just let players play as a monster. It makes them the monster. A writhing mass of teeth and tendrils that bursts through vents and drags screaming scientists into the oppressive dark. Every single encounter becomes a total inversion of survival horror, with humans scrambling about like pitiful mice while the creature grows stronger with each gruesome kill.

Yet the real horror creeps in gradually, subtly. The game forces players to revel in the carnage, only to then highlight the pitiful desperation of those trapped mercilessly in its path. The creature itself never doubts its purpose, but players? They do. And that unsettling dissonance lingers long after the last lab is painted entirely red.

The Darkness 2

Power With A Price

The Darkness 2
10 /10
Released
February 7, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Digital Extremes
Powered by

In The Darkness 2 , Jackie Estacado wields a curse that would make most horror villains green with envy. Twin demon heads sprout from his shoulders, capable of tearing enemies in half or devouring hearts right in the middle of a frantic firefight. Traditional horror pacing is replaced with explosive, unrelenting violence, but it remains deeply unsettling all the same.

The game constantly reminds players that this immense power comes at a terrible cost. Jackie's mind fractures under the sheer weight of his abilities, haunted by visions of his lost love and tormented by the sinister force that shares his very body. The gore is thrilling, absolutely, but the true horror is how utterly inseparable Jackie and the Darkness become.

Lucius

Childhood Isn't Always Innocent

Lucius
Horror
Adventure
Systems
Released
October 26, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Shiver Games
Powered by

Lucius puts players in the shoes of a child born with a truly demonic heritage, which quickly twists into calculated, cold-blooded murder. Instead of sneaking past monsters, players manipulate the household staff and use supernatural abilities to engineer gruesome "accidents." Poisoned wine, exploding gas leaks, meticulously staged electrocutions; these become the tools of a boy who never raises a single suspicion.

The tension here comes not from survival, but from the cold, chilling banality of evil. The mansion becomes a sinister puzzle box where trust is ruthlessly exploited, and every single room hides a potential crime scene. Horror is rarely this quiet or methodical, yet Lucius proves that power wielded without empathy is its very own kind of nightmare.

Manhunt

Hunters Become Hunted

Manhunt
7.8 /10
Released
November 18, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Rockstar North
Powered by

Rockstar’s Manhunt was hugely controversial for its sheer brutality, but what truly sets it apart is how it frames the player as both predator and victim. Cast in a sadistic snuff film, players stalk enemies through the shadows, armed with everything from flimsy plastic bags to sharp machetes. The kills are graphic, undeniably, yet the fear doesn’t actually come from being overpowered.

Instead, it's the chilling realization that players themselves have become desensitized. The more violent the execution, the higher the reward. The gameplay cunningly lures players into escalating cruelty until it feels routine, and that psychological manipulation is far more disturbing than any cheap jump scare. Manhunt turns power into a horrifying mirror of complicity.

Vampyr

The Hunger Defines You

Vampyr
5 /10
8.6 /10
Released
June 5, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Dontnod Entertainment
Powered by

Vampyr gives players control of Jonathan Reid, a doctor cursed with vampirism in a plague-stricken London. His supernatural powers make combat exhilarating, from shadow dashes to brutal, blood-draining finishers, yet every single ability feeds a relentless hunger that never, ever goes away. The true horror is moral rather than physical.

Players can choose to feed on the unsuspecting citizens of London, gaining great power at the cost of their humanity, or struggle valiantly against the temptation and remain weaker. Each choice is a perilous balancing act, with consequences that ripple across entire districts. The game forces players to stare at the monster in the mirror and decide how much of it they can truly live with.

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Will Require A Day One Patch
item.description:
Pokemon Legends: Z-A released version 1.0.1 just over a day before its October 16 launch date. While Patch 1.0.1 does not require much storage space to download and install, The Pokemon Company stated that the update will be necessary for Pokemon Legends: Z-A players to utilize the game's online features.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A will herald the return of Mega Evolution as a core battle gimmick and mark the arrival of a new, action-based battle system reminiscent of the Xenoblade Chronicles games. Pokemon Legends: Z-A will also take players back to Lumiose City, which first appeared in Pokemon X and Y . Though the game will not be released until October 16, early reviews of Pokemon Legends: Z-A have been mostly positive. As of this writing, Pokemon Legends: Z-A outscored one of its biggest competitors, Digimon Story: Time Stranger , on OpenCritic by a slight margin of 82 to 80.

Though preloading Pokemon Legends: Z-A is now available for users who already purchased the game via the Nintendo eShop, one more step will be necessary to enjoy some of its core features. Pokemon Legends: Z-A released version 1.0.1 late on October 14, just under two days before the game's release. The update is available for both the Switch and Switch 2 versions of Pokemon Legends: Z-A . Despite its small file size, The Pokemon Company stated that Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's version 1.0.1 update is necessary for the game's online modes to function. No other changes were listed in Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's version 1.0.1 update notes. While a Nintendo Switch Online membership is not necessary to download and install the 1.0.1 update, Pokemon Legends: Z-A players will still need one to experience the game's online modes, such as trading and battling.

Trainers interested in collecting every Mega Stone in Pokemon Legends: Z-A must also participate in the game's ranked Battle Club mode, which will pit up to four players in a three-minute, free-for-all match. The items needed for Mega Evolving Chesnaught, Delphox, and Greninja will be rewarded to players who participate in ranked Battle Club matches. However, it is currently unclear how many online matches will be necessary for trainers to claim their prizes.

While the 1.0.1 update will include necessary data for online functionality, Pokemon Legends: Z-A will still be missing Pokemon Home compatibility at launch. It remains to be seen how often Pokemon Legends: Z-A will release updates once the game is available worldwide.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Version 1.0.1 Patch Notes (October 14, 2025)

  • Added the data that needs to be updated to play online features

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: How To Build Dan Heng Permansor Terrae - Best Light Cones, Relics, And Eidolons In Honkai: Star Rail
item.description:
Dan Heng Permansor Terrae, usually abbreviated as Dan Heng PT, or DHPT, is the third form of Dan Heng in Honkai: Star Rail , with the first being his 4-star form and the second being Imbibitor Lunae. Unlike the first two forms, Dan Heng PT is a support and sustain. Here's how to build Dan Heng Permansor Terrae in HSR .

Dan Heng Permansor Terrae Build Overview In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Light Cones

  1. Though Worlds Apart
  2. Journey, Forever Peaceful
  3. Landau's Choice

Relics Sets

  • Self-Enshrouded Recluse

Planar Ornaments

  • Lushaka, the Sunken Seas
  • Space Sealing Station

Relics Stats

  • Body: ATK%
  • Feet: SPD
  • Planar Sphere: ATK%
  • Link Rope: Energy Regeneration Rate (ERR)

Relics Substats

  • SPD
  • ATK%

Best Dan Heng Permansor Terrae Light Cones In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

As a Preservation unit that scales with ATK instead of DEF, it's hard to find a Light Cone that can elevate Dan Heng PT's stats. Other than his signature Light Cone, Dan Heng Permansor Terrae needs to settle with normal Light Cones that buff or improve another aspect in his kit.

Light Cone

Why It's Good

Though Worlds Apart

Though Worlds Apart is Dan Heng PT's signature Light Cone, which automatically makes it DHPT's best-in-slot Light Cone in Honkai: Star Rail . Starting from its passive, the Though Worlds Apart Light Cone greatly increases Dan Heng PT's ATK by 64% without meeting any requirements. It also adds healing to his kit, allowing him to heal his team based on his ATK%. That's not all, because Though Worlds Apart can still greatly increase the team's DMG by up to 36% for 3 turns when Dan Heng uses his Ultimate.

Journey, Forever Peaceful

If you don't want to go for DHPT's Light Cone, you can build Dan Heng Permansor Terrae with the Journey, Forever Peaceful Light Cone in Honkai: Star Rail . The 4-star Light Cone improves the shield Dan Heng grants for his team, in addition to increasing the team's DMG by up to 20% if they are shielded.

Landau's Choice

Since the previous options are not F2P-friendly, you can build Dan Heng PT with Landau's Choice in Honkai: Star Rail . It's not really a useful Light Cone for Dan Heng, but it protects the team since it makes enemies more likely to attack him. As a shielder and a support in HSR , DHPT can perform well enough even without a Light Cone. So, Landau's Choice and any other Light Cone should be good enough until you pull for his signature.

Best Dan Heng Permansor Terrae Relics In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Relic Set

Why It's Good

Self-Enshrouded Recluse

The Self-Enshrouded Recluse Relic set improves Dan Heng PT's shielding ability on top of granting him a decent supportive buff. After that, every shielded unit in DHPT's party will get a 15% Crit DMG, and it remains as long as Dan Heng's shield is active.

Planar Ornament Set

Why It's Good

Lushaka, the Sunken Seas

Since buffing ATK% is one of Dan Heng's abilities, he's going to mostly support teams with DPS units that depend on ATK%, like Aglaea in Honkai: Star Rail . Not only that, but the 5% Energy Regeneration Rate really helps Dan Heng PT cast his Ultimate more often. Other ERR Planar Ornament sets, like Penacony, Land of the Dreams, is also good, but is more situational.

Space Sealing Station

You can build DHPT with the Space Sealing Station Planar Ornament Set, as it gives him a good ATK% boost. He can use that extra ATK% to slightly increase the buff he grants his Bondmate.

Dan Heng Permansor Terrae Eidolons In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Eidolons

Effect

Importance

S1

Shed Scales of Old

When Dan Heng • Permansor Terrae uses Ultimate, recovers 1 Skill Point(s) and increases the "Bondmate's" All-Type RES PEN by 18%, lasting for 3 turn(s).

Priority

S2

Watch Trails to Blaze

Increases the number of actions for the enhanced Souldragon from Ultimate by 2. After Dan Heng • Permansor Terrae uses Ultimate, Souldragon advances action by 100%. When the enhanced "Souldragon" takes action, the Additional DMG dealt by the "Bondmate" becomes 200% of its original DMG, and the Shield Effect provided in this instance becomes 200% of its original Shield Effect.

High

S4

By Oath, This Vessel Is I

Reduces the DMG taken by the "Bondmate" by 20%.

Low

S6

One Dream to Enfold All Wilds

When the "Bondmate" is on the field, increases the DMG taken by all enemies by 20%. When the "Bondmate" deals DMG, ignores 12% of the enemy targets' DEF. When Dan Heng • Permansor Terrae uses Ultimate, the "Bondmate" will deal Additional DMG of the Bondmate's Type to all enemies, equal to 330% of the Bondmate's ATK.

Priority

80
9.3 /10

Honkai: Star Rail

item.title: Battlefield 6: Which Audio Mix Should You Use (War Tapes, Explained)
item.description:
Audio is one of the key components of the Battlefield 6 multiplayer experience, and players will need to configure their audio mix settings to hear enemies better. War Tapes, alongside other Audio Mix settings, are used to change the character of sound produced in the game, like footsteps and gunfire. It's important to use the correct setting, which will allow you to detect and pinpoint the enemy position with greater accuracy in BF6 .

Which Audio Mix You Should Use in Battlefield 6? (War Tapes, Explained)

There are five different audio mix settings that players can choose in Battlefield 6 . Each audio mix setting alters the in-game sound characteristics, changing how you hear explosions, footsteps, and subtle sound cues in the game. Thankfully, each setting brings a unique experience to the table, and none of them have any major downsides.

However, let's try and break down all the audio mix settings in Battlefield 6 according to their usefulness, and which situations they'll be the most effective for.

Battlefield 6 Audio Mix

Audio Mix Description

Why Should You Use It

Default Mix

A balanced mix of medium dynamic range that comfortably distinguishes between loud and quiet sounds while retaining impact.

Ideal for Conquest and Breakthrough modes, especially in modes that require frequent switching between infantry and vehicle combat. Versatile mix that works great for both headphones and speakers.

High Dynamics

The largest differences between loud and quiet sounds. The mix is suitable for loud listening levels with high-end audio systems.

If you have the right audio gear, i.e., good headphones, this audio mix will be great for almost all modes. Adds a deeper contrast between quieter sounds like footsteps and weapon reloads to louder ones like explosions. Better used with headphones, but it can work on some speaker configurations.

Night Mode

It offers narrow dynamic ranges with a reduced low end, which makes it suitable for low-volume listening levels.

If you're playing Battlefield 6 on speakers, but want to tone down the louder sounds while still keeping footsteps and gunfire audible.

War Tapes

A raw and aggressive audio mix, which pairs narrow dynamic ranges with high distortion.

Delivers a punchy and bassy soundscape, delivering maximum impact. It may be the best audio mix for the BF6 Single-Player Campaign. Great for headphones that support 3D spatial audio.

War Tapes V.A.L.

War Tapes V.A.L. (Very Aggressive Listening) expands on the previous setting, increasing the raw aggression and making everything louder across the board.

Enhanced version of the War Tapes, which maintains the signature soundscape of the original but boosts the volume significantly. Works best for surround sound systems.

16
8.6 /10
9 /10

Battlefield 6
